content: - twigs and sticks - cinnamon sticks - knit i-cord - rolled felt twigs and cinnamon sticks add a cute rustic look to the knitted pumpkins i especially love the look of rough-edged tree twigs but they all look really cute in the end i - cord stalks make it easy to play with color and to customize your pumpkin they can be short and stubby long and twisty get creative with it i cord stalk with the same needles used to knit your pumpkin use a smaller weight yarn i used a worsted cotton yarn from bernat 1 cast on 6 sts 2 slide the 6 stitches over to the other needle knit 6 repeat round 2 six more times cut a long tail thread the tail through the live stitches on your needle now you will sew the stalk to the top of your pumpkin - i threaded the stalk s tail through 6 sts of the pumpkin s edge picked up one of the stalk s stitches and repeated all the way around until i had sewn the stalk through all of the pumpkin s stitches 2021 corinne hawari | hawari bazaar designs 3 details materials yarn- - hawari bazaar sultan singles yarn in colorways leaf jumper santa cecilia - hawari bazaar kohl fingering yarn in colorway pumpkin queen - contrast color for stalks needles notions us 11 / 8mm cabled needles cable needle us 1 / 2 25 cabled needles darning needle scissors polyfill / yarn scraps for stuffing abbreviations round/s round/s st/s stitch/es k knit p purl k2tog knit 2 together 2021 corinne hawari | hawari bazaar designs 4 lumpy pumpkin - us 11 needles - chunky weight yarn 2021 corinne hawari | hawari bazaar designs 5 cast on 60 sts or any multiple of 6 - leave yourself a longer tail you ll use this to close up your pumpkin at the end join in the round being careful not to twist your cast on edge - rnds 1-28 knit all stitches decrease row - round 1 *k5 k2tog* until the end - round 2 k2tog until the end - round 3 k2tog until the end cut a long tail about six times the length of your pumpkin tube or approx 36 inches you will be using this tail to create the lumps in your pumpkin do not cast off your stitches with your darning needle thread the long tail through the live stitches on your needles then slip them off pull your tail tight to cinch the stitches and close your pumpkin s bottom now you can stuff your pumpkin use polyfill yarn scraps wool remnants it s up to you using your long tail from your cast on thread your darning needle and pick up the loops along your casting edge pull your pumpkin closed but be careful not to pull too tight this is where you ll be adding in your stalk if you ve already got your stick twig or
